Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: We have activities: RO, CA, RI, PI, QC, PO, GSL, D, IC, RP.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - IND
Text: Equivalence: maybe RO and IC? Not sure. Maybe Generate Shipping Label (GSL) and Dispatch (D) are equivalent?

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Always Before: e.g., CA before RI; RI before PI; PI before QC; QC before PO; PO before GSL; GSL before D; D before IC?

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Activity Occurrences: each activity likely occurs 0 or 1 times except maybe some optional ones like CA could be 0 or 1

Name: Backtracking - NE
Text: But this requires all steps present sequentially which may not hold if any step omitted due to optionality

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Equivalence pairs: (CA, RI), (RI, PI), (PI, QC), (QC, PO), (PO, GSL), (GSL, D), (IC, RP)

Name: Deductive Reasoning - IND
Text: Always Before relations would include tuples where later task depends on previous task being already done earlier in trace i.e.: (RI,CA), (PI,RI), (QC,PI), (PO,QC), (GSL,PO), (D,GSL), (IC,D), (RP,IC)

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Always After: (RO, CA), (CA, RI), (RI, PI), (PI, QC), (QC, PO), (PO, GSL), (GSL, D), (D, IC), (IC, RP)

Name: Validation - IND
Text: Never Together: Activities cannot co-exist inside same case simultaneously - rarely used here unless certain mutually exclusive paths exist e.g., Cancelled orders path... In our simplified scenario there are no mutually exclusive branches described thus never_together empty set {}
